strategies: Execute only one action per turn. Never combine multiple actions in a single command as this will trigger a 'multi-action' error.
Always execute one action at a time and wait for the environment's response before proceeding to the next action.
Use the appropriate interaction method based on element type: fill() for text inputs, click() for buttons and links, and clear() only for editable input fields.
Always use send_msg_to_user() to communicate findings, results, or information to the user.
After encountering an error, modify your approach rather than repeating the same problematic action sequence.
Avoid repeated noop() actions when encountering challenges - instead, try alternative approaches or report specific limitations encountered.
When content is loading, use noop() with increasing durations (1000ms, then 2000ms) before determining a task is infeasible.
For multi-step processes, maintain awareness of the complete sequence required and track your progress through each step.
After completing what appears to be the main goal, look for a final confirmation or submission element to properly conclude the task.
Format information shared with users using bullet points, clear headings, and organized structure for better readability.
